Package server.services

Class SQLService

java.lang.Object
server.services.SQLService
public final class SQLService
extends java.lang.Object
Handles connections to the backend SQL server

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes 
    Modifier and Type Class Description
    static class  SQLService.Transaction
    Represents an SQL transaction

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    static java.sql.Connection getConnection()
    Gets the Connection to the SQL server associated with this Thread and creates one if it does not already exist
    static void setSQLServerPassword​(java.lang.String password)
    Sets the password to use to access the SQL server
    static void setTransactionProperties​(int transactionIsolation, boolean isReadOnly)
    Sets the properties which will be used for the next SQL transaction
    static SQLService.Transaction startTransaction()
    Starts an SQL transaction which will, by default, call SQLService.Transaction.rollback() on close
    static SQLService.Transaction startTransaction​(boolean commitOnClose)
    Starts an SQL transaction
    static SQLService.Transaction startTransaction​(int transactionIsolation, boolean isReadOnly)
    Starts an SQL transaction with the specified parameters which will, by default, call SQLService.Transaction.rollback() on close
    static SQLService.Transaction startTransaction​(int transactionIsolation, boolean isReadOnly, boolean commitOnClose)
    Starts an SQL transaction

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Method Details

    • setSQLServerPassword

      public static void setSQLServerPassword​(java.lang.String password) throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
      Sets the password to use to access the SQL server
      Parameters:
      password - the password to use
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the password has already been set

    • setTransactionProperties

      public static void setTransactionProperties​(int transactionIsolation, boolean isReadOnly) throws java.sql.SQLException
      Sets the properties which will be used for the next SQL transaction
      Parameters:
      transactionIsolation - the transaction isolation for the transaction
      isReadOnly - whether the transaction is readonly
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException - if there was an error accessing the SQL server
      See Also:
      Connection.TRANSACTION_READ_UNCOMMITTED, Connection.TRANSACTION_READ_COMMITTED, Connection.TRANSACTION_REPEATABLE_READ, Connection.TRANSACTION_SERIALIZABLE

    • getConnection

      public static java.sql.Connection getConnection()
      Gets the Connection to the SQL server associated with this Thread and creates one if it does not already exist
      Returns:
      a Connection to the SQL server associated with this Thread

    • startTransaction

      public static SQLService.Transaction startTransaction() throws java.sql.SQLException
      Starts an SQL transaction which will, by default, call SQLService.Transaction.rollback() on close
      Returns:
      a SQLService.Transaction representing the SQL transaction which will, by default, rollback on close
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException - if there was an error accessing the SQL server
      See Also:
      startTransaction(boolean), startTransaction(int, boolean), startTransaction(int, boolean, boolean)

    • startTransaction

      public static SQLService.Transaction startTransaction​(boolean commitOnClose) throws java.sql.SQLException
      Starts an SQL transaction
      Parameters:
      commitOnClose - whether the transaction will, by default, commit or rollback when closed
      Returns:
      a SQLService.Transaction representing the SQL transaction
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException - if there was an error accessing the SQL server
      See Also:
      startTransaction(), startTransaction(int, boolean), startTransaction(int, boolean, boolean)

    • startTransaction

      public static SQLService.Transaction startTransaction​(int transactionIsolation, boolean isReadOnly) throws java.sql.SQLException
      Starts an SQL transaction with the specified parameters which will, by default, call SQLService.Transaction.rollback() on close
      Parameters:
      transactionIsolation - the transaction isolation for the transaction
      isReadOnly - whether the transaction is readonly
      Returns:
      a SQLService.Transaction representing the SQL transaction which will, by default, rollback on close
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException - if there was an error accessing the SQL server
      See Also:
      setTransactionProperties(int, boolean), startTransaction(), startTransaction(boolean), startTransaction(int, boolean, boolean)

    • startTransaction

      public static SQLService.Transaction startTransaction​(int transactionIsolation, boolean isReadOnly, boolean commitOnClose) throws java.sql.SQLException
      Starts an SQL transaction
      Parameters:
      transactionIsolation - the transaction isolation for the transaction
      isReadOnly - whether the transaction is readonly
      commitOnClose - whether the transaction will, by default, commit or rollback when closed
      Returns:
      a SQLService.Transaction representing the SQL transaction
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException - if there was an error accessing the SQL server
      See Also:
      setTransactionProperties(int, boolean), startTransaction(), startTransaction(boolean), startTransaction(int, boolean)
